Bukan Cuma Lem Aibon, Ini Anggaran Janggal APBD DKI Temuan FITRA
06 Nov 2019, 23:01 by Imam Hamdi, Martha Warta Silaban
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Forum Indonesia Untuk Transparansi Anggaran atau FITRA menemukan anggaran janggal selain lem aibon di rancangan plafon anggaran 2020. Sekretaris Jenderal Sekretariat Nasional FITRA, Misbah Hasan, mengatakan menemukan anggaran janggal lain mulai dari pembelian gunting rumput, buku folio dan tenis meja.
"Data janggal tersebut kami dapatkan langsung dari sumber dari Rancangan KUA-PPAS 2020 DKI Jakarta," kata Misbah melalui pesan singkatnya, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Anggaran pembelian gunting rumput di Dinas Kehutanan, misalnya. Dinas Kehutanan menganggarkan Rp 491 juta, di mana Rp 223 juta di antaranya digunakan untuk pembelian gunting rumput sebanyak 1.324 unit di Suku Dinas Kehutanan Jakarta Utara.
Anggaran yang patut dipertahankan lainnya adalah pembelian buku folio di Dinas Pendidikan senilai Rp 78,8 miliar dan anggaran pembelian tenis meja Rp 8,9 miliar. Anggaran janggal lainnya yang tersisir FITRA adalah pembelian pulpen Rp 579,9 miliar dan penghapus cair Rp 24,1 miliar.
Bahkan, FITRA menemukan anggaran janggal pembelian lem aibon lebih tinggi ketimbang temuan anggota Fraksi PSI DKI William Aditya Sarana. William menemukan pembelian lem aibon Rp 82 miliar di Suku Dinas Pendidikan Jakarta Barat.
Sedangkan FITRA menemukan anggaran lem aibon hingga Rp 126,2 miliar di seluruh SKPD. "Ada beberapa prinsip yang dilanggar oleh Pemprov. DKI dalam penyusunan APBD DKI 2020 saat ini," ujarnya.
Pertama, menurut Misbah, DKI melakukan pelanggaran prinsip penyusunan APBD. Khususnya, pelanggaran terkait dengan ketepatan waktu dan prinsip transparansi.
Harusnya, Misbah berujar, Rancangan KUA PPAS 2020 diserahkan kepada DPRD pada pekan kedua Juli tahun ini, dan dibahas serta disepakati hingga pekan kedua Agustus. Namun, hingga sekarang, KUA PPAS 2020 DKI belum disepakati.
Kata Misbah, molornya waktu tersebut melanggar pasal 90 Peraturan Pemerintah nomor 12 tahun 2019 tentang Pengelolaan Keuangan Daerah. Kedua, prinsip transparansi diatur dalam pasal 2 Peraturan Menteri Dalam Negeri nomor 33 tahun 2019 tentang Pedoman Penyusunan APBD 2020.
"Meskipun Pemprov DKI enggan meng-upload dokumen KUA PPAS, harusnya ketika organisasi masyarakat sipil di DKI mengajukan permohonan dokumen tersebut, harusnya diberikan," ujarnya. "Hal ini juga diatur oleh UU Keterbukaan Informasi Publik."
Misbah memahami adanya keterlambatan pembahasan anggaran lantaran adanya pergantian dewan dari periode yang lama ke dewan periode 2019-2024. Namun, pergantian dewan hingga menunggu terbentuknya komisi tidak bisa dijadikan alasan utama molornya pembahasan.
"Kan bisa diberikan kepada Pimpinan DPRD. Hingga kini menurut pengakuan Ketua DPRD, beliau belum menerima Rancangan KUA PPAS 2020."
Anggaran janggal di Dinas Pendidikan DKI diungkap anggota Fraksi PSI DKI William Aditya Sarana. William mengungkap anggaran pembelian lem aibon yang mencapai Rp 82,8 miliar di Sudin Pendidikan Jakarta Barat dan pulpen seharga Rp 123 miliar di Sudin Pendidikan Jakarta Timur.
Selain itu, William juga mengungkap anggaran janggal seperti pembelian komputer Rp 121 miliar dan septic tank Rp 166 miliar.
text:
Not Just Aibon Glue, This is the Odd Budget of DKI's APBD Budget
06 Nov 2019, 23:01 by Imam Hamdi, Martha Warta Silaban
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Indonesian Forum for Budget Transparency or FITRA has found an odd budget in addition to aibon glue in the 2020 budget ceiling draft. Secretary General of the FITRA National Secretariat, Misbah Hasan, said that finding other odd budgets began with the purchase of grass shears, folio books and table tennis .
"We obtained the odd data directly from sources from the DKI Jakarta KUA-PPAS 2020 draft," Misbah said through his short message, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
The budget for purchasing grass shears at the Forestry Service, for example. The Forestry Service has budgeted Rp.491 million, of which Rp.223 million was used to purchase 1,324 units of grass shears at the North Jakarta Forestry Service.
Other worthy of maintaining budget is the purchase of folio books at the Education Office worth Rp. 78.8 billion and the budget for purchasing table tennis Rp. 8.9 billion. Another odd budget combed by FITRA is the purchase of Rp 579.9 billion pens and liquid erasers Rp 24.1 billion.
In fact, FITRA has found that the budget for buying aibon glue is higher than that of DKI Jakarta PSI Faction member William Aditya Sarana. William found the purchase of Rp. 82 billion of aibon glue at the West Jakarta Education Office.
While FITRA found a budget of aibon glue up to Rp 126.2 billion in all SKPD. "There are several principles that have been violated by the Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta in the preparation of the 2020 DKI Regional Budget," he said.
First, according to Misbah, DKI is violating the principles of APBD preparation. In particular, violations are related to timeliness and the principle of transparency.
Misbah should have said, the KUA PPAS 2020 Draft was submitted to the DPRD in the second week of July this year, and was discussed and agreed until the second week of August. However, until now, DKI KUA PPAS 2020 has not been agreed upon.
Misbah said, the delay was in violation of article 90 of Government Regulation number 12 of 2019 concerning Regional Financial Management. Second, the principle of transparency is regulated in article 2 of Minister of Domestic Affairs Regulation number 33 of 2019 concerning Guidelines for the Preparation of the 2020 APBD.
"Although the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government is reluctant to upload KUA PPAS documents, it should be that when civil society organizations in DKI submit the document request, it should be given," he said. "This is also regulated by the Law on Public Information Openness."
Misbah understands that there is a delay in the discussion of the budget due to the change of council from the long period to the council period 2019-2024. However, the change of council until waiting for the formation of the commission cannot be the main reason for the delay in the discussion.
"It can be given to the Chairperson of the DPRD. Up to now, according to the Chairperson of DPRD, he has not yet received the KUA PPAS 2020 draft."
An odd budget in the DKI Education Office was revealed by DKI PSI Faction member William Aditya Sarana. William revealed the budget for the purchase of aibon glue which reached Rp.82.8 billion in the West Jakarta Education Sub-Department and pens for Rp. 123 billion in the East Jakarta Education Sub-Department.
In addition, William also revealed odd budgets such as the purchase of Rp 121 billion in computers and Rp 166 billion in septic tanks.
